interestingFact: The ICC World XI is a team composed of top international players from different countries for exhibition matches.
India won its first Cricket World Cup in 1983 under Kapil Devâ€™s captaincy and again in 2011 under MS Dhoni.
Australia has won the most Cricket World Cups, with titles in 1987, 1999, 2003, 2007, 2015, and 2023.
England won its first ICC Cricket World Cup in 2019, defeating New Zealand in a thrilling Super Over finish.
Pakistan won the Cricket World Cup in 1992 under the leadership of Imran Khan.
South Africa is often referred to as 'chokers' in World Cups due to their near-miss performances.
New Zealand reached the World Cup final in 2015 and 2019 but finished as runners-up both times.
Afghanistan played its first Cricket World Cup in 2015 and has rapidly grown as a competitive cricketing nation.
Sri Lanka won the 1996 Cricket World Cup under the captaincy of Arjuna Ranatunga.
